name: Cameronian Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought I found a place to stay as this place advertises wifi... after arriving, I was told the wifi is turned off between 10-11PM every night to prevent guest from using skype at night. Some guests may like that, others may not... but it's something a potential guest should know.
reviews.title: FYI: wifi is turned off between 10-11PM

reviews.text: This lovely little guesthouse just a short walk into town is spotlessly clean and serves breakfasts, light meals, tea and coffee. The light-filled dining area is a comfortable place to relax and overlooks the gardens. They also work on the "honour system" - make your own tea/coffee, select some delicious home-made shortbread - just write it down on the paper provided.
reviews.title: Relaxed and friendly in a garden setting.
Nice place!
reviews.text: You can book tours and buses and Ganesh, the owner is a lovely chap who sent a car and arranged to have my luggage picked up for me from another accommodation place.

Surrounded by lovely manicured gardens there is a dorm room and private rooms with or without private shower and toilet. The prices are reasonable - MYR65 for a room with private facilities. Good value and a place I'd recommend. I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: It's awful, dirty and staff is unfriendly rude !!! Don't go !!!

reviews.text: Very comfy, friendly hosts, and MUST-TRY Tea and Scones! Yummy any time of the day!
reviews.title: Cameronian Inn is TERRIBLE! T-E-R-R-I-B-L-E!!!!!!! Please don't go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Cameronian Inn for two nights in the middle of April 2011. It's asmall, quiet guesthouse about 5mins walk from the main street. At first i was unsure as it seemed a bit too quiet for me (we were a group of 5 mid twenties to mid thirties), there wasn't anyone else about, but as the other gueshouses we'd tried were full, we took rooms in this one. It turned out to be quite a pleasant suprise; the guesthouse was basic but clean, with a lovely little terrace outside perfect for drinking a cold beer on, or trying one of their tasty scones.
reviews.title: Great little guesthouse - but need to improve on service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great sleep here, the rooms are cool and quiet - the inn has a "no noise" policy after 10pm which is good as is prevents the 18yr old boozy backpackers from staying here! You can also get a great cup of tea here which was welcomed by all our party.
reviews.title: Clean, good location and value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing I disliked about this guesthouse was the surly service from the family who run it. not once did I see them smile or look pleased to have our business. Infact I'd go as far as to call them rude at some points, tutting or kissing their teeth whenever we asked a question! If they dislike being guesthouse owners this much maybe they need to think of a new career!
reviews.title: they need times to prove their potential

reviews.text: Having said that you don't really see much of them, only to check in or check out so it's still worth staying in this little oasis :o)
reviews.title: Great value rooms for backpackers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made a last minute trip to the Camerons and selected several budget places from Trip Advisor. Settled on the Cameronian Inn, which had rooms available.
reviews.title: The Scones and Strawberry Jam were Tasty, but Room was Musky

reviews.text: Cameronian Inn is pretty okay, if all you want is a decent clean place to sleep and bathe at.
reviews.title: Okay place, bring your own towel though!

reviews.text: The exterior of the Inn looks like a cottage out of a fairytale, complete with a well-manicured lawn, beautiful flowers, pet rabbits and wooden benches, perfect for hanging out on a lazy day! Though I wish I could say nicer things about the inside :(
reviews.title: Extremely awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I booked a family room for RM100+/-, which isn't really value for money, as several other Inns and BBs in the area have much better amenities at a cheaper rate.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The room has a slight musty smell, and the beds really old, but it's quite clean. The toilet is really small, doesn't come with towels (RM 1 for a towel) and the shower can get alittle wonky, at times dispensing cold water only.
reviews.title: Friendly place, well run

reviews.text: There's a TV room in the Inn too. It has Astro cable, cushions, chairs. I suppose quite typical of most TV rooms in the area.
reviews.title: Warm, Welcoming, and Well-Run

description: A family-run guesthouse offering great location - short walking distance to the town center and bus station, homely atmosphere, clean and comfortable rooms with a spacious garden to laze and ample facilities.
